result.execSummary: Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Stephanie Marie Harris

records.addlTxt: Attorney Caitlin Hazard Firer in court via zoom conference.  Paul Leonard Tiffin appeared via zoom conference for the State of Wisconsin. Status conference held. Defendant was found not competent and not likely to regain competency. Defendant has pending Guardianship. Court orders case REMAINED suspended. No further dates needed at this time.

Attorney Caitlin Hazard Firer in court via Zoom, defendant Stephanie Marie Harris not in court, in custody.  Paul Leonard Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin via Zoom.
Case in court for Status Conference. State requests another date. No objection by defense. Case adjourned to Branch 38.  Status conference scheduled for September 10, 2020 at 08:30 am.

HELD OFF THE RECORD PER THE COURTS APPROVAL. Case currently set for status conference on 6/8/2020. Pursuant to the emergency order issued by the Chief Judge regarding the current public health crisis, this matter cannot be heard. Case adjourned for status on 6/8/2020 at 8:15 am, branch 38. LNR

Attorney Caitlin Hazard Firer in court, defendant Stephanie Marie Harris not in court, in custody.  Paul Leonard Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference. Defense counsel WAIVES defendant's appearance for today's hearing. For reasons as set forth, State requests a 2 year review. Court GRANTS State's request. Case is adjourned for status conference in Branch 38.  Status conference scheduled for April 30, 2020 at 08:30 am.
Examining psychologist's report written by Dr.John Pankiewicz dated 04-19-2018, received and filed.

Attorney Caitlin Hazard Firer in court, defendant Stephanie Marie Harris not in court, in custody, appearance waived. Paul Leonard Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: CDR  
Case is set for status conference. State placed on the record history of case as to civil commitment. State requests review of competency. Court ordered Dr. Pankiewicz appointed to evaluate defendant for competency. Order for Examination, signed and filed. Case adjourned for status of Doctors Report on 04/27/18 at 8:15 am, branch 38.  Status conference scheduled for April 27, 2018 at 08:15 am.

records.addlTxt: Attorney Caitlin Hazard Firer in court.  Paul Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for status. Status of defendant placed on the record. Court continues suspended proceedings and set case over for review in a year. Case remains calendared in Branch 28.  Status conference scheduled for February 22, 2018 at 08:15 am.

Attorney Caitlin Hazard Firer in court, defendant Stephanie Marie Harris not in court, in custody.  Paul Leonard Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: LM  
Doctor's report received and filed.  State requested the defendant be re-examined.   Parties reviewed report and do not contest findings.  Court found defendant previously not competent to proceed and unlikely to regained competency.  Defendant remains not competent and unlikley to regained competency.  State to notify corporate counsel of defendant current state.  Court order report to be sealed.  Status conference scheduled for February 22, 2017 at 08:30 am.
from John Pankiewicz, received and filed. lms

Attorney Caitlin Hazard Firer in court, defendant Stephanie Marie Harris not in court, in custody.  Paul Leonard Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  
Defendant not produced, counsel waives appearance for hearing.

NO FILE IN COURT.  Defendant was recently found not competent and not likely to regain competency.  Chapter 55 was institution defendant is currently at community placement.  State is requesting defendant be re-examined for competency by Dr. Pankiewicz.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed. 

Court order the defendant's address sealed.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for February 22, 2016 at 08:30 am.
LETTER INFORMING THE COURT OF DEFENDANT'S TRANSFER FROM LOCKED INPATIENT UNIT INTO A SUPERVISED HOUSING FACILITY.  RECEIVED AND FILED
STATUS ON CIVIL COMMITMENT PROCEEDING

Defendant Stephanie Marie Harris in court with attorney Lisa M. Procaccio.  Defendant Stephanie Marie Harris in custody.  Paul L. Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jennifer Rhodes appeared for the County of Milwaukee.
Parties stipulate to doctor's report.  Court finds defendant is not competent and not likely to regain competency.  Court ordered that:
- proceedings suspended  and the defendant is discharged from the criminal competency  commitment;
- defendant shall be taken into custody and promptly delivered to an approved treatment detention facility or medical/protective placement facility.
The State is to advise court the status of defendant's treatment by 1-11-2016.
Filed:
- signed, Order on Competency;
- signed, Order of Conversion to Civil Commitment Proceedings Under 971.14(6), Wis. Stats.

Defendant Stephanie Marie Harris in court with attorney Caitlin Hazard Firer.  Defendant Stephanie Marie Harris in custody.  Ronald Dague for Paul L. Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dugan, Branch 10.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant waived time limits for Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Stephanie Marie Harris in court with attorney Lisa M. Procaccio.  Defendant Stephanie Marie Harris in custody.  Antonio Apollo for Paul L. Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense is requesting an adjournment.  State informs the Court that they are ready to proceed with witnesses that are present for today's proceedings.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Stephanie Marie Harris in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Defendant Stephanie Marie Harris in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge DUGAN, Branch 10.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.

  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).

  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
